intro: Ficaria rotundifolia, commonly known as the buttercup sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its foliage is edible and has a mildly sour taste, making it a popular herb in some culinary traditions.
